section.name: Prepare
section.p: Follow all steps documented on the Developing with Maven page. Don't continue with the instructions on this page before you have seen a running application.

li.p: Help -> Software Updates -> Find and Install...
Search for new features to install
Apply changes and close the dialog
Help -> Software Updates -> Find and Install...
Search for new features to install
Help -> Software Updates -> Find and Install...
Search for new features to install
Help -> Software Updates -> Find and Install...
Search for new features to install
Uncheck 'Use project classpath when running tools'

Add the jars for jpox-core, jpox-enhancer and bcel to the classpath. Currently the version 1.2.0-beta-2 is used for JPOX and 5.1 for BCEL; to maintain consistency with the maven build, check these values in the jpox-maven-plugin pom file.

section.name: Create Eclipse projects
section.p: WARNING: Make sure that there is no .project file in the toplevel (hippo-ecm) directory before proceding. If there is one the eclipse import projects wizard will fail.
section.source: ~/> cd hippo-ecm ~/hippo-ecm> mvn clean ~/hippo-ecm> mvn eclipse:eclipse

li.p: Start eclipse, the workspace directory can be any directory EXCEPT the directory under which you have checked out the source (~/hippo-ecm in the example)
Run the import project wizard: File -> Import -> General -> Existing Projects into Workspace
All hippo-ecm projects should be listed

subsection.name: Fix dependencies
subsection.p: Not all dependencies are correctly set by the maven eclipse plugin, these dependencies have to be set manually.

li.p: In the configuration panel (Project -> Properties), select 'Java Build Path'
In the configuration panel (Project -> Properties), select 'Java Build Path'

subsection.name: RMI
subsection.p: For projects that provide objects that can be accessed remotely, (hippo-ecm-repository-engine, hippo-ecm-repository-application, hippo-ecm-addon-sample-repository, hippo-ecm-addon-reviewed-action-repository) stubs must be created by rmic. The plugin can be used to do this:

li.p: right-click project -> RMI -> Enable Stubs generation

subsection.name: JPOX
subsection.p: Projects that provide document types (hippoecm-repository-engine, hippo-ecm-addon-sample-repository, hippo-ecm-addon-reviewed-action-repository) must be enhanced by the JPOX plugin: open the 'Package explorer' view and:

li.p: Right-click the project -> JPOX -> Add JPOX Support

section.name: Jetty launcher
section.p: Create Jetty launcher configurations for the projects hippo-ecm-application-reviewed-action-repository and hippo-ecm-application-reviewed-action-frontend. As a convention port 8081 is used for the repository and 8082 for the frontend.
Additional configuration is necessary to enable RMI.

li.p: Open the debug configuration panel (e.g. Run -> Open Debug Dialog...)
Set the webapp dir to src/main/webapp
Define the variable m2_loc (Variables -> Edit -> New) as the path to the local maven repository (e.g. /home/user/.m2/repository on Unix systems)
Define the variable ecm_loc as the path of the toplevel directory (e.g. /home/user/hippo-ecm)
Open the debug configuration panel (e.g. Run -> Open Debug Dialog...)
Set the webapp dir to src/main/webapp

section.name: Run
section.p: You can now debug the frontend and repository applications at the same time, within Eclipse.
